thanks

item.title: Need help bringing server online

item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

He was explaining how to change the ip address on an average client in case it was using the loopback ip…What’s incorrect about it

Read full topic

item.title: Need help bringing server online
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

[quote=“Noobinator9907, post:5, topic:534129”]If none of the above posts work, open your Clients folder and go in to the folder with the .java files. Find client.java and open it in notepad. Press Ctrl + F and search “server =” (Without the "'s).

Should look something like this

[code]}

public client() { 
tabHPos = -1;
	alertHandler = new AlertHandler(this);
	fullscreenInterfaceID = -1;
	chatRights = new int[500];
	chatTypeView = 0;
	clanChatMode = 0;
	cButtonHPos = -1;
	cButtonHCPos = -1;
	cButtonCPos = 0;
	server = "127.0.0.1";[/code]

Change where it says 127.0.0.1 to whatever your IP then compile it and it should work. This is only if you’re using a PI 317, you can try searching 4359 (If I recall) with ctrl + f then scrolling down and looking for an IP and changing that.[/quote]
That’s incorrect, actually.
You use localhost when you want to connect to your own server, and use your server’s IP address when having others connect to your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help bringing server online
item.dc:creator: @Noobinator9907 Noobinator9907
item.description:
@Noobinator9907 wrote:

If none of the above posts work, open your Clients folder and go in to the folder with the .java files. Find client.java and open it in notepad. Press Ctrl + F and search “server =” (Without the "'s).

Should look something like this

[code]}

public client() { 
tabHPos = -1;
	alertHandler = new AlertHandler(this);
	fullscreenInterfaceID = -1;
	chatRights = new int[500];
	chatTypeView = 0;
	clanChatMode = 0;
	cButtonHPos = -1;
	cButtonHCPos = -1;
	cButtonCPos = 0;
	server = "127.0.0.1";[/code]

Change where it says 127.0.0.1 to whatever your IP then compile it and it should work. This is only if you’re using a PI 317, you can try searching 4359 (If I recall) with ctrl + f then scrolling down and looking for an IP and changing that.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help bringing server online
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Null Amount:

There are no offerings of payment here. All services and help are free (besides Scar scripts).

Also, try checking out tutorials such as this one and asking for help on any actual errors you’ve encountered. From what I read I’m assuming you haven’t tried anything because you don’t know where to start.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help bringing server online
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

Why don’t you explain where you’re having trouble so that someone can lead you in the right direction. If you can’t learn to do things on your own, then you should either put some money down on a developer to do it for you, or give up right now.

Read full topic
